855990792:
[

Brand Manager

Company Name Seqirus Company Location Parkville, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 193 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Starting a century ago, CSL made a promise to save lives and protect the health of people stricken with a range of serious and chronic medical conditions. Today that same promise has never been stronger. Seqirus, a CSL Company, manufactures and in-licenses, markets and distributes specialty pharmaceuticals and vaccines for the prevention and treatment of serious disease, but most significantly, Seqirus is a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally. \xa0


If the challenges of tomorrow inspire you more than the achievements of yesterday; If you can push boundaries while promoting proven approaches; If you think great ideas can come from anywhere so everyone's voice should be heard; If you believe a successful company can be profitable and compassionate, Seqirus is for you!


An opportunity has arisen within our Commercial Operations Vaccines team. Reporting to the Marketing Manager and working with a highly talented marketing and sales team, you will have specific Brand Management responsibilities. This is an exciting opportunity managing an innovative influenza vaccine. Highly visible both within the organisation and the target market, you will develop and shape this vaccine market.


You will possess excellent communication skills, strong business acumen and commercial skills, together with strong planning and organisational abilities. \xa0At least two years Brand Management experience preferably in the Pharmaceutical industry is ideal. The ability to liaise effectively with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders is critical for this role.


Tertiary level qualifications in science or a related discipline (and preferably post graduate business/marketing) or business qualifications will be complemented by your marketing, experience. \xa0You'll demonstrate the ability to drive and cultivate effective working relationships, together with a strong customer focus.\xa0


If you are looking to develop your skills and shape the health of Australians, please apply.


Applications must address the selection criteria above and include a current CV and covering letter.


Applications will close on Friday \xa021st September 2018 \xa0Job reference is R- 067086


CSL advises that screening including; criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience, stated qualifications and other relevant checks form a part of the candidate suitability evaluation process. Where applicable, this applies to current CSL employees. CSL employees must notify their current manager when selected for interview for any advertised internal vacancies.


Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
Seqirus does not accept unsolicited referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Seqirus' Talent Acquisition to obtain prior written authorisation before referring any candidates to Seqirus. The obtaining of prior written authorisation is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Seqirus. In the absence of such written authorisation being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Seqirus. Seqirus shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site

Learning and Development Manager

Company Name Think Talent Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 170 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



  • Competitive salary plus STI
  • Initial focus on Insurance division - then roll out across the Group
  • State-of-the art offices in Melbourne CBD




The Organisation
 This dynamic and successful organisation specialises in providing insurance, superannuation, and professional services to specialised industry sectors. They have a reputation for developing and supporting their people in an innovative and technology-driven culture. With brand new offices in the heart of the Melbourne CBD, they offer an agile working environment with many opportunities.




The Opportunity
 In this newly created role, you will report into the Senior Manager Talent and Capability and will lead a team of four, to manage and oversee the learning and development function. With an initial focus on the Insurance division, you will develop learning frameworks, systems and processes to meet learning needs. This program will then be rolled out across the broader group, so it is a great opportunity to broaden your experience to an enterprise-wide function.



  • Work proactively to identify learning needs
  • Develop and monitor learning plans in line with business needs
  • Develop and implement skills-based training programs
  • Facilitate training programs when required
  • Ensure adherence to insurance industry compliance and legislative requirements




To Be Successful
 You will be a passionate learning and development leader who loves to see people grow and develop and are committed to fostering a learning culture. With a sound background in design and delivery of learning experiences, it is essential that you bring experience from within the insurance industry.



  • Sound L&D experience at a managerial level within the insurance industry
  • Strong experience in designing, developing and deploying technical skills-based training programs
  • Confident knowledge of L&D principles and frameworks
  • Facilitation skills that engage an audience and able to tailor delivery style
  • Able to source and distil information from multiple sources into simple training materials
  • Strong team leadership and influential stakeholder management skills




Interested? For prompt consideration "apply now" or for a confidential discussion, please contact Steven Burrows at Think Talent on 0407 848 156.

Senior Statutory Planner

Company Name City of Casey Company Location Narre Warren

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Summary


The City of Casey is an ambitious, innovative and customer-focussed Council driven by our vision of 'creating Australia's most liveable city'. As the largest and one of the fastest growing municipalities in Victoria, Council plans and delivers quality services and infrastructure for the more than 314,000 residents who call Casey home.


The organisation recently moved into Bunjil Place, offering staff a modern, flexible and collaborative working environment as we strive to shape the future of Casey and deliver the most efficient and customer-centric services for our community.


The Role


An exciting opportunity exists for a highly motivated Senior Statutory Planner to work in our diverse and dynamic Statutory Planning and Building Department.


You will be responsible for implementing and administering the statutory planning controls along with contributing to the implementation of our strategic planning framework and Casey's appeal as a desirable place to live, invest and do business. There will be an emphasis on managing high profile matters, mentoring and developing, as well as process improvement.


About you


Ideally you will possess a relevant tertiary qualification and the ability to contribute to an integrated approach to all sections within the Statutory Planning section at Casey.


\xa0


We encourage people with a disability, lived experience of disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait islanders and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply for this position.


The City of Casey has zero tolerance for child abuse and is committed to creating and maintaining a child safe organisation where protecting children and preventing and responding to child abuse is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all Councillors, employees, contractors and volunteers.


The City of Casey reserves the right not to make any appointments for this position.



Salary begins at $85,112 per annum plus super

Mid-Senior level

Project Coordinator

Company Name Corplex Pty Ltd Company Location Port Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 435 views

Job description

Corplex Pty Ltd is a growing and dynamic privately owned construction company that was founded in 1990. Since inception, Corplex Pty Ltd has gained a broad base of experience in all types of construction, involving a wide and varied client base including the government, commercial, industrial and residential sectors.


So, we need someone that can fit right in, has a go-getter attitude and likes to be challenged. We're relaxed, but work hard, we have fun and we respect each other. We are searching for the next member of our Complex family!


To be successful, you must meet the following criteria:


  • Must have a minimum of 2 years experience in the Commercial or Industrial industry;
  • Tertiary degree in an associated field;
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills demonstrated project coordination skills, effective negotiation skills, and decision-making abilities;
  • Proven experience in coordinating construction projects from start to finish, including but not limited to coordination of trades, purchasing and procurement, programming and scheduling and general day- to -day project coordination;
  • A great client satisfaction track record;
  • Ability to use Jobpac, Merlin/Microsoft Projects and a Mac would be preferable, but not essential as we provide training;
  • Must have full work rights for Australia coupled with local experience

What do you get?

  • A very attractive remuneration package for suitably experienced candidates.
  • Excellent career development opportunities with our growing company.
  • Working in a dynamic and fun team culture.
  • Fantastic opportunity to work alongside a supportive and highly skilled team.
  • Opportunity to work on a wide range of high-end construction projects to further expands on your current skills.


This is a fantastic opportunity to join us as a Project Coordinator with room to grow and further develop your own skills and career aspirations.


This position is an immediate start, so please do not hesitate in submitting your application! Any questions please contact our HR Coordinator - Nancy Jahnke 03992 26922

Look forward to hearing from you!

\xa0

  • CBD Based

Hudson has an exciting opportunity for an experienced and delivery focussed Capital Works Project Manager to work with a leading Independent Statutory Body on a longterm contract position, available immediately.

The Role:
The purpose of this role is to provide high quality service, advice and support in the delivery of capital and infrastructure projects across a large and complex portfolio of assets. You will be responsible for the delivery of projects from conception to completion working in collaboration with a diverse team.

Your key responsibilities will be to:

  • Plan and develop major projects and initiatives
  • Initiate and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle
  • Oversee the procurement and contract management of consultants, builders etc
  • Plan, develop and implement projects that contribute to asset lifecycle management
  • Provide input to policy and guideline development


About you
To be successful for this role, you must have the following skills and experience:

  • Relevant qualifications in Project Management and or construction highly desirable (Prince2) and working knowledge of MSProject tools
  • The ability to use your initiative to make decisions under pressure
  • Previous experience working on Capital Projects within the Built Environment
  • Effective stakeholder management and the ability to work in a deadline driven environment
  • Previous experience managing end to end capital works projects across large scale projects


What you will get in return
This is a unique opportunity to join our client during a period of sustained growth and an increase in capital works projects. You will be a part of a diverse team with varied background and will be mentored by industry leaders who are passionate about giving back to their community. Your remuneration package will be from $95k-$115k + super per anum.

[

Customer Delivery Coordinator

Company Name Vocus Group Limited Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 260 views

Job description

As the fourth largest Telco in Australia, Vocus Group continues to grow and we are looking for a Customer Delivery Coordinator with excellent customer service skills.

You will be responsible for providing superior customer service and unrivalled assistance of provisioning related enquiries to Partners through the management of inbound call queues and various ticketing systems.

The day to day


  • Take ownership of customer's problems and ensure a resolution is reached
  • Receiving calls, provide first-line Customer liaison
  • Prepare, submit and manage “Adds, Moves and Change” orders for voice and data services
  • Recording and tracking Incidents, Service Requests and complaints
  • Making initial assessment of tickets, attempting to resolve them or refer them to other Resolver Groups based on agreed Service Levels
  • Follow monitoring and escalation procedures relative to the appropriate SLA
  • Managing the Incident life-cycle, including closure and verification of tickets
  • Communicating planned and short-term changes of Service Levels to Customers
  • Providing management information and recommendations for service improvement
  • Identifying Problems for Data, Voice, Mobile and Internal IT Systems
  • Highlighting Customer training and education needs
  • Participating in ongoing team training
  • Document standard operating procedures for internal and external customers
  • Provide report analysis on request


What you need to bring to the table

Technical:


  • Telecommunications background is required
  • Knowledge of ITIL principles and processes desirable
  • Experience in supporting Voice Communication networks
  • Strong understanding of Data Networks, Protocols and Equipment
  • Experience in supporting Microsoft services, applications and networking
  • Good Microsoft Excel skills
  • Some experience with Supplier Management
  • High-level competence and knowledge of Internet Technologies and Voice Communication technologies


Non-technical:


  • Strong problem analysis and resolution skills
  • Strong customer service focus
  • Experience in performing a customer support role
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and documentation skills
  • Excellent time management and multi-skills
  • Commitment to following a structured and disciplined work flow practice
  • Commitment to continuous improvement
  • Ability to work both autonomously and within a group
  • A proactive, flexible and positive attitude
  • High attention to detail, with motivation and focus
  • Ability to work with tight deadlines
  • Ability to work with competing and changing priorities
  • Good understanding of the business information needs of the organisation
  • Effective trouble-shooter
  • Strong resilience in dealing with competing needs and deadlines
  • NV1 Security clearable

\xa0
